Dear Ana McClain:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the violations
identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The corrective action plan is
due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact me. In
any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an acceptable
corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any questions. In
the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone immediately, please contact
the area manager Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-6992.
Sincerely,
Shannon (Shay) Mavis

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program Statement
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
1

(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care, safety,
and supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth were left unsupervised in a movie theatre for 15-30 minutes
while a staff took a personal phone call.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Chief Administrator (CA) was interviewed via phone on
5/28/24. CA reported she did not have any further information
about the allegations. CA reported Staff 1 was suspended pending
this investigation.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on 5/31/24.
Youth A reported on 5/24/24, Staff 1 took Youth A and Youth B to
a movie theater. Towards the end of the movie, Youth A reported
Staff 1 stepped out of the movie and took an important call. Youth
A reported approximately 15 minutes later, Staff 1 returned to the
movie, and then they left the theater. Youth A reported she didn’t
have any concerns about the situation, but thought it was odd
because she’s been on many other outings and staff have never
left youth alone.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on 5/31/24.
Youth B reported Staff 1 took Youth A and Youth B to the movie
theater on 5/24/24. Youth B reported when they were in the car on
the way to the theater, Staff 1 received a text message. When
they arrived at the theater, Staff 1 told Youth A and Youth B she
had a personal emergency phone call she would have to take
during the movie, and she would have to step out. Youth B
reported Staff 1 asked him to keep an eye on Youth A when she
stepped out because Youth A has previously gone AWOL from an
outing. Youth B reported Staff 1 asked him to come get her if
Youth A moved or tried to leave. Youth B reported Staff 1 stepped
out of the movie for approximately 15 minutes. Youth B reported
he has been on other outings and staff have never left him or any
other youth alone before.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 5/31/24.
Staff 1 reported when she was in the car with Youth A and Youth
B on the way to the movie theater, she received a text message
from a family member. Staff 1 reported the family member told her
she was going to be in an upcoming potentially unsafe situation
and wanted Staff 1 to be on the phone with them to hear what was
happening. Staff 1 reported she, Youth A and Youth B were
seated in the middle aisle in the movie, which leads to the exit.
2

Staff 1 reported when she received the phone call, she told Youth
A and Youth B she needed to take a call and would be right back.
Staff 1 reported she asked Youth B to keep an eye on Youth A
since Youth A was higher risk for AWOL. Staff 1 reported Youth A
and Youth B were separated by one seat in between them. Staff 1
reported since she was listening, but not talking on the phone call,
she didn’t fully exit to the movie. Staff 1 reported she was on the
other side of the wall leading toward the exit, so she peaked
around to check on Youth A and Youth B but did not watch them
constantly. Staff 1 reported she was on the phone call for
approximately 10 minutes. Staff 1 reported she had to take the call
because it was an emergency, and she felt she accounted for
every possible scenario that could happen to avoid something like
this investigation occurring. Staff 1 reported she regrets agreeing
to take the call now, but at the time, she did not feel it was that
serious.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• Activity Treatment – Residential Staff Expectations policy
states staff are expected to make certain there is no
unsupervised interaction among youth while attending
activities.
• Staff Ratio Policy states direct care staff are required to
always maintain line-of-sight supervision of youth except
when youth are in their individual sleeping rooms or
bathroom.
• Truancy and Missing Persons Policy states to prevent
AWOL, staff will avoid allowing youth to remain out of their
immediate sight lines.
• Staff 1 has one disciplinary action in the form of a growth
plan in her employee file, which is unrelated to this
investigation. Staff 1 received training on policies related to
supervision of youth during orientation in July 2023.
Analysis The agency is found in non-compliance as per interviews
conducted and documentation reviewed, Staff 1 did not follow the
facility’s policies regarding supervision of youth.
Technical Assistance:
Technical assistance was offered for the facility to remind staff it is
not appropriate to request a youth watch/supervise another youth.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR #2023C0000002 dated 12/5/22; CAP approved 12/22/22
SIR #2023C0000274 dated 5/1/23; CAP approved 5/26/23
3

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
July 1, 2024
Shannon (Shay) Mavis Date

sir_summary.summary: A staff member at a youth residential facility took two youths to a movie theater and left them unsupervised for 10-30 minutes to take a personal emergency phone call, instructing one youth to watch the other. The facility's policies require constant line-of-sight supervision of youth during activities. This is a repeat violation of supervision rules. The staff member is directly culpable for the violation, as they knowingly disregarded established safety protocols.
